summary: We testified on fraud risks in immigration benefit programs administered by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) before the Senate Committee on the Judiciary, Subcommittee on Border Security and Immigration. It is based primarily on the following reports: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services: Additional Actions Needed to Manage Fraud Risks Humanitarian Parole: DHS Identified Fraud Risks in Parole Processes for Noncitizens and Should Assess Lessons...
title: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services: Implementing GAO's Recommendations Would Help Manage Fraud Risks in Immigration Benefit Programs
